intro: Alyxia obovata var. oubatchensis, commonly known as the Oubatch's alyxia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate to obovate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in shrubland or woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
